text: - My name is Sabine,

I'm a business development
and capture manager,
and I'm based in Berlin.
In my role, I work with AWS customers
in the public sector and partners

to share best practices
on how to procure cloud.

Before I joined AWS, I
worked for government.

So for me, it was basically
seeing this big tech company

that was changing how
like IT basically works.

So seeing it from the outside,
it was super interesting
but also quite daunting.

From the inside, AWS
is still a big company
but it feels more like a startup.
(bright music)
Working with the public sector

I think has a huge impact like
on the economy or on society
because we play an important role
in digitizing the public sector,

in providing technology
services that actually also,

for us as citizens,
really make a difference.
(bright music continues)
Within AWS, I am part of

the German Mental Health and
Wellbeing Affinity group,

so actually my proudest moment
was when we held an event,
and somebody reached out afterwards
saying that actually like it changed
like the way they approach work
and it made a difference to them.

To describe my experience
at AWS in three words,

I would say it's valuable,
it's transformational,
and it's entrepreneurial.
(bright music continues)
